I hate it.

Its really fun, however its also really frustrating and with every update come many bugs. Also the community is pretty toxic, but the memes are great.
This game is the best buy it now!

Personally, I enjoy this game at its moments.  I truly do.  My issue when it comes to this game is the Fun part.  You can't have a game anymore without a Sweaty teams, or a killer that is Fully set up in perks and add-ons.  With killers coming out over powered, Or with an over powered Kit at launch.  Takes them 3-4 months it feels like at times to "Adjust" them.  Killers like Pig Just Got Thrown under the Bus after her nerfs.  Even with the Add-on Changes for her which are to help her, Just feel like they're Slowing her down a tad.  Especially with the Bug with her New Iri Add-on.  This game was fun, It still can be, But its Very rare to have a game where you can actually sit back and enjoy the game, and not Try to play like a pro player.  

     In Short, They Had an amazing game, Then Ruined it with all the Bugs they've refused to fix, or let go un fixed.  Killers Coming out with a powerful kit, or an underdone kit. Matchmaking is Not fun anymore.  Feels like the Devs Care VERY Little about our opinions.
this game is a bit scary

No matter what you do, you will get shit on. 
All players are bad, all players are mad, behaviour exclusively nerf them and buff others, it's a whine-tasting seminar and YOU are invited. Game itself can be fun, but the "community" and "culture" (insofar as you can call it a culture) is absolutely dogshit.

Play it with friends exclusively, and you can have fun. Nobody is happy in public games.

If i were to point out everything that's wrong with DBD and Behaviour Interactive, i'd be writing this all day and night. 

I've never seen a less competent team of Developers, ever. 
So many bad design/balancing choices and utter laziness it's actually incredible.

Yes I have wasted a lot of hours on this game, as there was nothing like it in the genre, it is addictive in a sense, but horrible and unrewarding.

They don't care about the game and neither should you.
